intro: Galium jussiei, commonly known as the Jussie bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its slender stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
